intro: Cyrtandra × koolauensis, commonly known as the Koolau hybrid, is a hybrid plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Cyrtandra × koolauensis is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of Hawaii and is often found in moist, shaded forest environments.
